thread.title: Suffolk Poll: Trump Unlikeable, But Leads GOP Field
thread.title_full: Suffolk Poll: Trump Unlikeable, But Leads GOP Field

author: MARC FORTIER
title: Suffolk Poll: Trump Unlikeable, But Leads GOP Field
text: Privacy Policy | More Newsletters FILE - AP Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump talks about his tax plan during a news conference, Monday, Sept. 28, 2015, in New York. The Republican front-runner is calling for an overhaul of the tax code that would eliminate income taxes for millions of Americans, while lowering them for the highest-income earners and business. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson) Updated 6 hours ago A new Suffolk University/USA TODAY national poll shows Donald Trump continuing to lead the GOP presidential field at 23 percent. Trump is trailed by Ben Carson and Carly Fiorina, who are tied at 13 percent apiece. Next up are Marco Rubio at 9 percent, Jeb Bush at 8 percent, Ted Cruz at 6 percent, and John Kasich, Rand Paul and Mike Huckabee at 2 percent each. Bobby Jindal, Lindsey Graham and Chris Christie all garnered just 1 percent. Interactive 2016 N.H. Primary Candidate Tracker The poll also showed that Trump's favorability remains low, at just 27 percent, the lowest of the 10 Republican candidates polled. Sixty-one percent of voters said they disapprove of him. "Despite topping the Republican ballot test, Trump's overall favorability numbers should be of concern to his campaign," said David Paleologos, director of the Suffolk University Political Research Center in Boston. "Trump is the Jekyll and Hyde candidate - strong when among conservative voters but viewed much differently once Democrats and independents are in the mix." When asked what one word best describes Trump, 10 percent said "idiot,""jerk,""stupid" or "dumb." Six percent said "arrogant" or "crazy/nuts," while another 5 percent said "buffoon,""clown,""comical," or "joke." Published 6 hours ago
